articles.headline: Facebook Software Puts It Front and Center on Android Phones
articles.snippet: A new interface, called Facebook Home, is designed for Android phones and makes Facebook pervasive on the devices.
articles.abstract: A new interface, called Facebook Home, is designed for Android phones and makes Facebook pervasive on the devices.
articles.lead_paragraph: 9:20 p.m. | Updated Added more details and analysis.

articles.headline: Finding a Rate That’s Fairer Than Libor
articles.snippet: A benchmark based on secured loans makes more sense than the London interbank offered rate.
articles.abstract: A benchmark based on secured loans makes more sense than the London interbank offered rate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Perhaps it is time to feel sorry for the big banks, at least when it comes to Libor. If they do what some regulators want, it appears they will be directly defying other regulators. If they do what those other regulators want, they may end up facing criminal charges.

articles.headline: Schumer’s New Brief: Turning Foes Into Friends
articles.snippet: Senator Charles E. Schumer is not only an envoy to the White House but also the Democratic majority’s most important bipartisan bridge builder.
articles.abstract: Senator Charles E. Schumer is not only an envoy to the White House but also the Democratic majority’s most important bipartisan bridge builder.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For much of the last decade, Senator Charles E. Schumer’s job was to bury Republicans, as one of his party’s most ruthless strategists and tireless fund-raisers. It was a job he did so effectively that he was asked to do it twice.

articles.headline: H.P. Chairman Steps Down as 2 Resign From Board
articles.snippet: The company said Raymond J. Lane was stepping down just two weeks after his narrow re-election.
articles.abstract: The company said Raymond J. Lane was stepping down just two weeks after his narrow re-election.
articles.lead_paragraph: In another upheaval for the board of Hewlett-Packard, the company said on Thursday that Raymond J. Lane, its embattled chairman, was stepping down from that post, just two weeks after his narrow re-election. Two other directors departed the board entirely.

articles.headline: Texas Refinery Is Saudi Foothold in U.S. Market
articles.snippet: The Motiva refinery in Port Arthur, the largest in the United States, ensures a bigger market for Saudi crude and a stronger global voice for the kingdom.
articles.abstract: The Motiva refinery in Port Arthur, the largest in the United States, ensures a bigger market for Saudi crude and a stronger global voice for the kingdom.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT ARTHUR, Tex. — It is hard to imagine the desert sands of the Persian Gulf being any farther away than from this swampy refinery port known for Cajun food, sport fishing and being the birthplace of Janis Joplin.

articles.headline: Beijing Flaunts Cross-Border Clout in Search for Drug Lord
articles.snippet: The manhunt that led to a notorious trafficker’s capture was a hard-nosed display of the Chinese government’s political and economic sway across Laos, Myanmar and Thailand.
articles.abstract: The manhunt that led to a notorious trafficker’s capture was a hard-nosed display of the Chinese government’s political and economic sway across Laos, Myanmar and Thailand.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAN MOM, Laos — It was 100 miles downstream from China, on the banks of the Mekong River, where a notorious drug lord slipped ashore in the dusk into the hands of law enforcement.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and Bree Feng

articles.headline: Fed Is Weighing a Reaction to Stirrings of Recovery
articles.snippet: Federal Reserve officials are wondering how to remain cautious even as signs show that the labor market is improving more rapidly than expected.
articles.abstract: Federal Reserve officials are wondering how to remain cautious even as signs show that the labor market is improving more rapidly than expected.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal Reserve officials are grappling publicly with a better kind of problem than most they’ve confronted in recent years: what if the labor market continues to improve more rapidly than they had expected?

articles.headline: Obama Budget to Include Cuts to Programs in Hopes of Deal
articles.snippet: President Obama will take the political risk next week of presenting a budget plan that proposes cuts to Social Security and Medicare, in an effort to compromise with Republicans.
articles.abstract: President Obama will take the political risk next week of presenting a budget plan that proposes cuts to Social Security and Medicare, in an effort to compromise with Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama next week will take the political risk of formally proposing cuts to Social Security and Medicare in his annual budget in an effort to demonstrate his willingness to compromise with Republicans and revive prospects for a long-term deficit-reduction deal, administration officials say.

articles.headline: Hiring in U.S. Tapers Off as Economy Fails to Gain Speed
articles.snippet: Employers added only 88,000 jobs in March, a pace of growth too sluggish to make a big dent in the backlog of idle workers. The jobless rate dipped to 7.6 percent from 7.7 percent.
articles.abstract: Employers added only 88,000 jobs in March, a pace of growth too sluggish to make a big dent in the backlog of idle workers. The jobless rate dipped to 7.6 percent from 7.7 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: It looks as if the spring swoon is back.

articles.headline: Payment for Act of Kindness: 2 Days in Car Trunk at Age 89
articles.snippet: When two girls in Delaware wanted a ride and Margaret E. Smith, 89, obliged, their journey became a frightening encounter along the way.
articles.abstract: When two girls in Delaware wanted a ride and Margaret E. Smith, 89, obliged, their journey became a frightening encounter along the way.
articles.lead_paragraph: LINCOLN, Del. A steel-haired woman, 89 years old and an inch short of five feet, sat on a pillow in the driver’s seat of her Buick LeSabre, just thinking. Parked outside a convenience store on one of the last days of winter, she was considering a pre-Easter treat for herself: an ice cream cone. Butter pecan.
